content:
• Thursday, January 3, 2019
  • RCII

    Rent-A-Center -2% as judge favors restraining order for Vintage

    • Judge Sam Glasscock III says he expects to grant a temporary restraining order to Vintage Capital later this week, with Rent-A-Center (NASDAQ:RCII) trying to pull out of a $1.37B acquisition deal, Bloomberg reports.
    • He's expecting a one- or two-day trial on the matter to come next month.
    • Vintage sued in December after Rent-A-Center attempted to pull out of the deal amid concerns the deal couldn't reliably close.
    • RCII is down 2% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:09 PM | 4 Comments
  • AMID

    AMID, SWN, FLXN and CMI among notable after hour movers

    • Top Gainers: AMID +24.4%. RECN +11.7%.NVAX +9.3%. SIGA +3.9%. SWN +3%.
    • Top Losers: FLXN -3.9%. TAK -2.1%. PCG -1.8%. CMI -1.6%. PVG -1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM | 3 Comments
  • RETA

    Reata Pharma on go with late-stage study of bardoxolone in ADPKD; shares up 2% after hours

    • Reata Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:RETA) is up 2% after hours following its announcement of the design of a Phase 3 clinical trial, FALCON, evaluating bardoxolone methyl in patients with autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease (ADPKD).
    • The randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study will enroll ~300 subjects. The primary endpoint will be the change from baseline in estimated glomerular filtration rate (a measure of kidney function) after 48 weeks of treatment and a four-week withdrawal period compared to control.
    • The trial should commence mid-year.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • NVAX

    Novavax up 10% after hours on positive NanoFlu data

    • Novavax (NASDAQ:NVAX) is up 10% after hours in response to its announcement of positive results from a Phase 2 clinical trial evaluating a range of formulations of flu vaccine NanoFlu with and without the Matrix-M adjuvant.
    • All formulations were well-tolerated and induced "vigorous" immune responses to the four strains in the vaccine.
    • Matrix-M adjuvant elicited significantly enhanced immune responses compared to unadjuvanted vaccine.
    • A Phase 3 study is next up.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 61 Comments
  • FLXN

    Flexion Q4 revenue up 36%; shares down 19% after hours on Zilretta outlook

    • On a preliminary basis, Flexion Therapeutics (NASDAQ:FLXN) generated $9.5M in revenue in Q4, up 36% yoy. Full-year revenue was ~$22.5M.
    • The company expects ZILRETTA (triamcinolone acetonide) sales this year of $65M - 80M.
    • Management will host a conference call tomorrow, January 4, at 8:30 am ET to discuss the results and outlook.
    • Shares are down 19% after hours in apparent reaction to its ZILRETTA outlook.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • AVA

    Idaho regulator denies Avista sale to Canadian utility

    • Avista (AVA -1.8%) tumbles to a 52-week low on news that the Idaho Public Utilities Commission denied its pending merger with Hydro One (OTC:HRNNF).
    • The move in Idaho follows similar action last month by Washington regulators, who also denied the sale.
    • The Idaho PUC says the sale is prohibited by state law, which prohibits the transfer of assets from a regulated electric utility to an entity that is "owned or controlled, directly or indirectly, by... any other state."
    • Although Hydro One is an investor-owned utility, Canada's Ontario province is its largest shareholder with 47% of outstanding shares, giving it significant control and influence over the utility, the commission says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 6 Comments
  • XOM

    Oil prices rebound after early slide, as surveys show declining output

    • Crude oil prices rose for the fourth straight session in volatile trade, boosted by separate surveys that revealed monthly production declines from major producers; February WTI settled +1.2% to $47.09/bbl, while Brent +1.9% at $55.95/bbl.
    • OPEC produced 32.68M bbl/day of oil in December, down 460K bbl/day from the previous month, according to a Reuters survey, while a survey from Bloomberg showed OPEC output down by 530K bbl/day to 32.6M bbl/day.
    • "Oil is flip-flopping on concerns of supply and demand," says Price Futures analyst Phil Flynn. "It’s really a battle between the supply situation, which looks to be tightening, versus the possibility that demand will drop off."
    • Today’s "volatility across risk assets, including energy, is growth related and fears of a slowing global economy continue to be a major headwind on oil from a demand standpoint," says Tyler Richey of the Sevens Report.
    • "Oil is due for a bounce as futures are oversold but without a notable catalyst, and a rebound in stocks, it will be hard for WTI to rally beyond resistance in the low $50s," Richey adds.
    • Most oil and gas stocks trade lower, along with the rest of the equity market: XOM -1.4%, CVX -1.7%, COP -1.7%, RDS.B -0.2%, BP +0.5%.
    • ETFs: USO, XLE, OIL, UWT, UCO, VDE, XOP, DWT, ERX, OIH, SCO, BNO, DBO, ERY, DIG, BGR, GUSH, DTO, FENY, USL, IYE, DUG, DRIP, IEO, FIF, DNO, NDP, PXE, OLO, RYE, PXJ, SZO, CRAK, FXN, OLEM, WTIU, DDG, OILK, NANR, OILX, WTID, USOI, USOU, USOD, FTXN, JHME, ERYY, ERGF, OILD, OILU, USAI
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM | 69 Comments
  • EDAP

    EDAP up 21% on first U.S. sale of Focal One

    • Thinly traded nano cap EDAP TMS SA (EDAP +20.9%) is up on more than a 4x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 241K shares, following its announcement of the first U.S. sale of its Focal One HIFU device used to treat localized prostate cancer.
    • The John Wayne Cancer Institute in Santa Monica, CA acquired the system.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • QTWO

    Stephens bumps Q2 up to Overweight

    • Investment bank Stephens upgrades Q2 Holdings (QTWO -1.3%) from Equal-Weight to Overweight and cuts the target by a dollar to $59. (Source: Briefing.com.)
    • Q2 shares have pulled back 16.7% in the quarter but are up nearly 30% in the past year.
    • The company reported strong Q3 results in November and last month acquired digital onboarding company Gro Solutions.
    • Post updated to correct the price target.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • BOXL

    STM, OLED & EMAN among notable tech movers

    • Gainers: Boxlight (NASDAQ:BOXL) +36%. FTE Networks (NYSEMKT:FTNW) +19%. IZEA Worldwide (NASDAQ:IZEA) +17%. Park Electrochemical (NYSE:PKE) +13%. OptimizeRx (NASDAQ:OPRX) +10%.
    • Losers: eMagin (NYSEMKT:EMAN) -12%. Universal Display (NASDAQ:OLED) -13%. STMicroelectronics N.V. (NYSE:STM) -12%. Cool Holdings (NASDAQ:AWSM) -12%. Arlo Technologies (NYSE:ARLO) -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM | 4 Comments
  • ALB

    Albemarle -6% as Berenberg downgrades, seeing start of fundamental shift

    • Albemarle (ALB -6.1%) falls sharply after Berenberg downgrades shares to Hold from Buy with a $90 price target, slashed from $130, saying it had not anticipated "what appears to be a concerted attempt by national governments" to pressure lithium prices in order to promote local battery production.
    • Last month's announcement by state-owned Bolivian miner YLB that it will cooperate with German partner ACI Systems to produce 40 kt of lithium hydroxide from 2022 could mark the start of a fundamental shift in supply, Berenberg's Sebastian Bray says.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 4 Comments

  • Stocks return to session lows

    • A bounce attempt has failed for now, with all of the major averages again down 2% or more.
    • There are some pockets of green, including biotech (IBB +1.1%), which is benefitting from Celgene's $74B sale to Bristol-Myers, and the utilities (XLU +0.3%). Consumer Staples (XLP -0.1%) are also holding up.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 13 Comments
  • CCLP

    CSI Compressco and PermRock Royalty Trust among Energy/Materials gainers; Platinum Group Metals and Pacific Ethanol among losers

    • Gainers: CSI Compressco (NASDAQ:CCLP) +12%. PermRock Royalty Trust (NYSE:PRT) +11%. Rosehill Resources (NASDAQ:ROSE) +10%. Americas Silver (NYSEMKT:USAS) +9%. Ossen Innovation (NASDAQ:OSN) +8%.
    • Losers: Platinum Group Metals (NYSEMKT:PLG) -9%. Pacific Ethanol (NASDAQ:PEIX) -8%. Versum Materials (NYSE:VSM) -7%. Venator Materials (NYSE:VNTR) -6%. Eclipse Resources (NYSE:ECR) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM | 2 Comments
  • AQST

    Needham sees 27% upside in Thermo Fisher in today's analyst action

    • Aquestive Therapeutics (AQST +0.3%) initiated with Buy rating and $14 (97% upside) price target at Lake Street.
    • Thermo Fisher Scientific (TMO -2.1%) initiated with Strong Buy rating and $271 (27% upside) price target at Needham.
    • PerkinElmer (PKI -3.5%) initiated with Hold rating at Needham.
    • NeoGenomics (NEO -3%) initiated with Buy rating and $14 (16% upside) price target at Needham.
    • Myriad Genetics (MYGN +0.2%) initiated with Strong Buy rating and $36 (25% upside) price target at Needham.
    • Genomic Health (GHDX +1.3%) initiated with Strong Buy rating and $86 (37% upside) price target at Needham.
    • Danaher (DHR -2.5%) initiated with Buy rating and $114 (16% upside) price target at Needham.
    • Bruker (BRKR -3%) initiated with Strong Buy rating and $39 (38% upside) price target at Needham.
    • Agilent (A -2.9%) initiated with Buy rating and $77 (21% upside) price target at Needham.
    • WellCare Health Plans (WCG -0.8%) upgraded to Outperform at Wolfe Research.
    • Gilead Sciences (GILD +4.1%) upgraded to Outperform with an $85 (29% upside) price target at Oppenheimer.
    • Intricon (IIN -4.3%) upgraded to Buy with a $44 (79% upside) price target at Dougherty & Co.
    • Molina Healthcare (MOH -5.6%) downgraded to Peer Perform at Wolfe Research.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM | 2 Comments
  • CRL

    Contract research organizations in the red on BMY/CELG tie-up

    • The broad market's bearish mood notwithstanding, contract research organizations (CROs) Charles River Laboratories (CRL -4.5%), ICON (ICLR -4.5%), IQVIA (IQV -3.9%) and PRA Health Sciences (PRAH -5.3%) are all under pressure in apparent response to Bristol-Myers Squibb's $74B bid for Celgene.
    • Jefferies' Jared Holz says investors typically regard mega mergers as a negative for the CROs, although stocks in the group were down over 20% last month.
    • Goldman's Robert Jones believes the BMY/CELG merger could be a positive for ICLR since it has a long-term relationship with BMY.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • SYBX

    Synlogic up 3% on key 2019 events

    • Thinly traded micro cap Synlogic (SYBX +3.1%) is up on below-average volume after announcing key pipeline events for 2019.
    • SYNB1020: Topline data from Phase 1b/2a study in patients with cirrhosis and elevated ammonia expected mid-year.
    • SYNB1891: IND for Phase 1 study to be filed in H2 for the STING agonist.
    • On the capital front, its cash and equivalents should be sufficient to fund operations through 2020.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • HRTX

    Heron up 3% on positive HTX-011 data

    • Heron Therapeutics (HRTX +2.6%) is up on average volume in response to its announcement of positive results from pain management study evaluating the combination of HTX-011 and over-the-counter pain meds (acetaminophen and ibuprofen) for managing postoperative pain.
    • 90% of patients receiving the combo regimen did not need opioids for postoperative pain through 72 hours after surgery, superior to 51%, 40% and 22% of patients receiving HTX-011, bupivacaine and placebo, respectively.
    • 81% of patients receiving the combo remained opioid-free through 28 days after surgery.
    • The company's U.S. marketing application seeking approval for HTX-011 + meloxicam is currently under FDA review with an action date of April 30.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM | 5 Comments
  • YIN

    Yintech Investment Holdings leads financial gainers; Warrior Met Coal and Equity Bancshares among losers

    • Gainers: Yintech Investment Holdings (NASDAQ:YIN) +7%. Green Brick Partners (NASDAQ:GRBK) +6%. Maiden Holdings (NASDAQ:MHLD) +6%. Loop Industries (NASDAQ:LOOP) +6%. The Simply Good Foods (NASDAQ:SMPL) +6%.
    • Losers: China Rapid Finance (NYSE:XRF) -10%. Warrior Met Coal (NYSE:HCC) -7%. Senmiao Technology (NASDAQ:AIHS) -6%. Equity Bancshares (NASDAQ:EQBK) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • JNCE

    Jounce advancing early-stage study of PD-1 inhibitor; shares up 2%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Jounce Therapeutics (JNCE +2.3%) is up on below-average volume on the heels of its announcement that it has completed enrollment in the first cohort in a Phase 1 clinical trial evaluating PD-1 inhibitor JTX-4014 in patients with solid tumors.
    • The study's objectives are safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics and to identify the recommended dose for a Phase 2 trial. The estimated primary completion date is September 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 12 Comments
  • ATRA

    Atara Bio in-licenses CAR-T candidate from Memorial Sloan Kettering

    • Atara Biotherapeutics (ATRA -9%) has exclusively in-licensed a mesothelin-targeted CAR-T therapy from Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center.
    • Mesothelin is a protein that is highly expressed in certain cancers, including malignant mesothelioma, pancreatic and ovarian cancer and lung adenocarcinoma.
    • Financial terms are not disclosed.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • BTAI

    Healthcare dominate midday movers

    • Gainers: BioXcel Therapeutics (NASDAQ:BTAI) +35%. EDAP TMS S.A. (NASDAQ:EDAP) +27%. Celgene Corporation (NASDAQ:CELG) +24%. Lifeway Foods (NASDAQ:LWAY) +18%. Cocrystal Pharma (NASDAQ:COCP) +16%. MOGU (NYSE:MOGU) +17%. Estre Ambiental (NASDAQ:ESTR) +16%. IZEA Worldwide (NASDAQ:IZEA) +15%. Tetraphase Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:TTPH) +15%. AzurRx BioPharma (NASDAQ:AZRX) +15%.
    • Losers: Sesen Bio (NASDAQ:SESN) -33%. LightInTheBox Holding (NYSE:LITB) -20%. China Ceramics (NASDAQ:CCCL) -17%. Co-Diagnostics (NASDAQ:CODX) -17%. Prana Biotechnology (NASDAQ:PRAN) -17%. Soleno Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SLNO) -14%. Bristol-Myers Squibb (NYSE:BMY) -14%. Vaxart (NASDAQ:VXRT) -16%. Renmin Tianli Group (NASDAQ:ABAC-OLD) -13%. Fortress Biotech (NASDAQ:FBIO) -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 2 Comments
  • PCRX

    Pacira down 9% on Exparel sales results

    • The market's down day notwithstanding, Pacira Pharmaceuticals (PCRX -9.1%) is getting rudely treated after reporting preliminary Q4 and 2018 sales figures for EXPAREL (bupivacaine liposome injectable suspension).
    • Unaudited Q4 and 2018 sales were $94M (+19%) and $331M (+17%), respectively. Full-year guidance was $325M - 330M.
    • The company says new reimbursement codes that went into effect on January 1 should boost patient access.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 5 Comments
  • AAPL

    App Store made $1.22B over holidays

    • Apple (AAPL -8.2%) announces that App Store spending topped $1.22B between Christmas Eve and New Year's Eve, a new holiday spending record.
    • Customers spent over $322M on New Year's Day alone.
    • The announcement follows yesterday's Q1 warning on iPhone weakness in China, which has the Street seeing red. But notable analysts including Morgan Stanley's Katy Huberty have remained bullish on Apple's Services potential even as weak iPhone data poured in.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 85 Comments
  • BMY

    Investors lack enthusiasm for Bristol-Myers Squibb's Celgene bid; shares down 13%

    • Investors are clearly signaling their opinion with the premium Bristol-Myers Squibb (BMY -12.8%) will pay for Celgene. Shares are down on more than a 5x surge in volume.
    • The bid was $50 in cash plus one share of BMY common stock, valued at $102.43 before the open, now worth ~$96 based on recent trade.
    • $96 represents a 4.7x multiple of trailing 12-month sales and a 23.9x multiple of trailing 12-month EPS.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM | 39 Comments
  • RCI

    Rogers Communications +1.6% as National Bank bumps to Outperform

    • Rogers Communications (NYSE:RCI) has jumped to a 1.6% gain on NYSE, a rare up mover in today's down market, after National Bank Financial upgraded shares to Outperform.
    • Analyst Adam Shine boosted his price target on the company to C$78 from C$71, implying 11.7% upside from current pricing in Toronto.
    • On NYSE, RCI shares have gained 7.8% over the past six months but are down 3.4% in the past month.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM | 1 Comment

  • Yields leg out new lows after soft ISM print

    • The December ISM fell all the way to 54.1 from 59.3 previously. Expectations had been for a rather modest decline to 57.9.
    • Leading the drop was a whopping fall in New Orders to 51.1 from 62.1. Production slumped to 54.3 from 60.6, Supplier Deliveries to 57.5 from 62.5, and Employment to 56.2 from 58.4. Prices dropped to 54.9 from 60.7, and Backlogs to 50.0 from 56.4.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield is off another four basis points to 2.58%, and the Two-year yield is down five basis points to 2.42%. Short-term interest rate futures are now pricing in a rate cut in 2019 as more likely than a rate hike - this vs. the Fed "dots" which show central planner expectations for 2-3 more rate hikes this year.
    • TLT +1.1%, TBT -2.2%
    • ETFs: TLT, TBT, TMV, IEF, TBF, EDV, TMF, TTT, ZROZ, PST, VGLT, IEI, TLH, VGIT, UST, UBT, DTYS, TYO, SPTL, GSY, DLBS, SCHR, VUSTX, TBX, TYD
     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM | 11 Comments

  • Tech lunch: Apple, suppliers drag the Street

    • Apple's Q1 guidance cut is weighing on the Street today with suppliers along for the ride. Mellanox is also plunging on concerns its new CFO appointment means the company won't pursue a sale.
    • The tech sector (NYSEARCA:XLK) is down 3.4% with the tech-heavy Nasdaq 100 down 1.9%, the S&P 500 IT Index -3.5%, and the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index falling 4.3%.
    • Related semiconductor ETFs: SOXL, SOXX, SMH, USD, PSI, XSD, SOXS, SSG, FTXL, XTH
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • CRBP

    Corbus Pharma up 6% on Kaken collaboration

    • Corbus Pharmaceuticals (CRBP +5.6%) is up on 33% higher volume in response to its collaboration with Kaken Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd. aimed at developing and commercializing lenabasum in Japan for systemic sclerosis and dermatomyositis.
    • Under the terms of the partnership, Corbus will receive $27M upfront, up to $173M in milestones and double-digit royalties on net sales. Kaken will have exclusive in-country rights to lenabasum for the two indications.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • LWAY

    New Age Beverages and China XD Plastics among consumer gainers; Apple and Fabrinet among losers

    • Gainers: Lifeway Foods (NASDAQ:LWAY) +14%. Eastside Distilling (NASDAQ:EAST) +8%. Electrameccanica Vehicles (NASDAQ:SOLO) +7%. New Age Beverages (NASDAQ:NBEV) +6%. China XD Plastics Company (NASDAQ:CXDC) +6%.
    • Losers: Renmin Tianli Group (NASDAQ:ABAC-OLD) -13%. Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) -8%. Liberty TripAdvisor Holdings (NASDAQ:LTRPA) -7%. Fabrinet (NYSE:FN) -5%. Arcimoto (NASDAQ:FUV) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM | 9 Comments
  • SPACE

    Iridium set to wrap up next-gen satellite deployment

    • Iridium (IRDM -1.7%) is set to wrap up its NEXT satellite deployment, with the last 10 satellites mated, fueled and ready to launch on Tuesday, the company's CEO says.
    • Matt Desch says the company will deploy the last of the next-generation satellites Jan. 8 with help from SpaceX (SPACE). A launch last summer brought the total number of NEXT satellites to 65; the new launch will bring full deployment of 75.
    • With the deployment completed, 2019 will mark a decline in capital spending for Iridium, Desch says.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 12 Comments
  • POAHY

    Porsche U.S. retail sales +4.4% in December

    • Porsche (OTCPK:POAHY) unit sales rose 4.4% to 4,086 units in December.
    • 911 sales up 2.1% to 789 units.
    • 718 sales fell 21.3% to 237 units
    • Cayenne sales increased 47.1% to 1,383 units.
    • Panamera sales down 27% to 332 units.
    • Macan sales grew 6.9% to 1,345 units.
    • YTD Porsche U.S. sales +3.2% to 57,202 units.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • OBLN

    Obalon down 14% after commercial plan update

    • Thinly traded nano cap Obalon Therapeutics (OBLN -13.9%) slumps on average volume following its conference call this morning to update investors on its commercial plan for its Navigation System that supports the placement of its intragastric balloon for the treatment of obesity without the need for an x-ray.
    • Investors appear disappointed that the Navigation System is not compatible with the current balloon kit that relies on x-ray guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • CATB

    Catabasis Pharma up 6% on clinical advancement of DMD candidate edasalonexent

    • Catabasis Pharmaceuticals (CATB +6.1%) is up on below-average volume in response to its update on its Phase 3 clinical trial, PolarisDMD, evaluating edasalonexent (CAT-1004) in boys with Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD).
    • Nine U.S. trial sites are now open with at least 10 more expected to open shortly. Sites in Canada will come on line this month followed by sites in Europe, Australia and Israel later this quarter. A total of 40 sites will eventually participate.
    • The primary endpoint is the change from baseline in North Star Ambulatory Assessment (NSAA) at week 52. Topline data should be available in Q2 2020.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • SFTBY

    Bloomberg: SoftBank hires Goldman veteran for new investment unit

    • SoftBank (SFTBY -1.2%) has hired a Goldman Sachs (GS -1.7%) veteran to head up a new investment unit, Bloomberg reports.
    • The company has hired Hiroki Kimoto, an 18-year Goldman employee, in the latest move in SoftBank's evolution from telecom to tech investment giant.
    • Kimoto most recently was managing director of Asian Special Situations in Goldman's Securities Division, where he helped the firm invest in Japanese golf courses, hot springs and distressed assets. He joins SoftBank on Friday, according to the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 5 Comments
  • MCRB

    Seres up 7% on launch of mid-stage study of SER-287 in ulcerative colitis

    • Thinly traded micro cap Seres Therapeutics (MCRB +7.2%) is up on below-average volume on the heels of the launch of a pivotal Phase 2b clinical trial, ECO-RESET, evaluating microbiome therapeutic candidate SER-287 in patients with active mild-to-moderate ulcerative colitis.
    • The start of the study triggered $40M in milestone payments from Nestlé Health Science.
    • The primary endpoint of the 201-subject trial is the clinical remission rate after 10 weeks of dosing. The estimated primary completion date is July 2020.
    • The company says the results, together with data from a second pivotal study, could support a U.S. marketing application.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • NSANF

    Nissan U.S. sales up 7.6% in December

    • Nissan (OTCPK:NSANY) unit sales +7.6% to 148,720 units vs. -6.1% forecast by Edmunds.
    • Nissan truck sales grew 14% Y/Y to 95,174 units.
    • Nissan car sales down 2.1% to 53,546 units.
    • Sales growth by brand: Nissan +7.2% to 130,655 units; Infiniti +10.3% to 18,065 units.
    • Rogue sales up 6% to 42,523 units during the month.
    • Sentra +4.4% to 17,567 units.
    • YTD Nissan sales slipped 6.2% to 1,493,877 units.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 2 Comments
  • CLDR

    Cloudera-Hortonworks merger closes

    • The Cloudera (CLDR -8.8%) and Hortonwork (NASDAQ:HDP) merger closes today with CLDR remaining as the publicly-traded ticker.
    • Hortonworks shareholders received 1.305 Cloudera shares for each HDP share in the all-stock merger. Cloudera holders will own about 60% of the equity of the combined company.
    • Cloudera execs will host a conference call on January 10 at 1:00 PM ET to discuss the new company.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 6 Comments
  • AAPL

    A double-whammy for Berkshire Hathaway

    • Apple's (AAPL -8.9%) decline after cutting its Q1 revenue guidance means at least ~$3.8B paper loss for Berkshire Hathaway's (BRK.B -4.3%)(BRK.A -4.3%) 252M-share stake in the maker of iPhones.
    • Berkshire's stock is taking an even bigger hit. Markets are down broadly as Apple's lower expectations stem from weaker demand from China.
    • With B shares losing $8.64 in late morning trading multiplied by 2.46B shares outstanding, Berkshire has lost $21.4B in market cap just this morning.
    • The Oracle of Omaha, though, is famous for focusing on long-term returns and ignoring the day-to-day gyrations of the stock market.
    • Previously: Berkshire Hathaway goes 30-year fixed on $1B in debt (Jan. 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM | 185 Comments
  • EYPT

    EyePoint Pharma readies two product launches; shares up 2%

    • EyePoint Pharmaceuticals (EYPT +2.1%) plans to launch two products this quarter, DEXYCU (dexamethasone intraocular suspension) 9% for the treatment of postoperative inflammation in the eye, and YUTIQ (fluocinolone acetonide intravitreal implant) 0.18 mg for the long-term treatment of non-infectious posterior segment uveitis.
    • CEO Nancy Lurker says manufacturing has been scaled up and commercial infrastructure established to support the launches.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • FOLD

    Amicus launches Phase 1/2 study of gene therapy for Batten disease; shares up 4%

    • Amicus Therapeutics (FOLD +4.3%) initiates a Phase 1/2 clinical trial evaluating gene therapy candidate AAV9-CLN3 in children with CLN3 Batten disease, an inherited nervous system disorder characterized by intellectual disability, vision impairment and seizures.
    • The study will enroll seven children ages 3 - 10. The first patient has been dosed and showed no serious adverse events during the one-month observation period.
    • The estimated completion date is December 2022.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • BTAI

    Celgene and Alliqua BioMedical among healthcare gainers; Bristol-Myers Squibb and Prana Biotechnology among losers

    • Part of a big Financial Times report on Spotify's (SPOT -3.2%) efforts to replicate Latin American success around the world is reporting that the company's licensing talks in India are at a dead end.
    • Investors are hoping that Spotify can repeat rapid growth in the U.S., Europe and now Latin America (with little investment) in the "rest of the world." At home, Apple recently bumped Spotify as the most popular paid music streaming service.
    • Spotify made a November debut in the Middle East and last year also entered South Africa, Israel, Vietnam and Romania.
    • But in India, large labels still haven't given Spotify a licensing green light, the FT says. Seeing that Spotify now needs growth as a publicly traded company, the labels are pushing back on Spotify requests to offer free trials for several months.

    • CBS (CBS -0.4%) has acknowledged earlier reporting about a breakdown in its relationship with ratings provider Nielsen (NLSN -0.9%), saying it's at a "contractual impasse" on the deal.
    • "The entire media industry is aware of the need for complete and accurate measurement across platforms," CBS says in its statement.   • BTAI

    BioXcel up 20% premarket of positive dexmedetomidine data

    • Thinly traded nano cap BioXcel Therapeutics (NASDAQ:BTAI) is up 20% premarket on light volume in response to its announcement of Phase 1 data on IV dexmedetomidine (Dex) for the treatment of agitation in patients with Senile Dementia of the Alzheimer's Type (SDAT).
    • 70% (n=7/10) of treated patients achieved arousal sedation (-1 score on a scale called RASS) compared to 25% (n=1/4) for placebo. The drug was well-tolerated and a safe dose was identified.
    • The company says the positive outcome supports the rationale for Fast Track-tagged BXCL501, a sublingual formulation of dexmedetomidine. Top-line data from a a Phase 1 dose-escalation pharmacokinetic study should be available in H1.
    • Management will host a conference call at 11:30 am ET to discuss the results.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
